input.text:
Why is there no "Figma for data visualization" yet?

Tableau: enterprise bloatware, $70/mo
PowerBI: Microsoft lock-in
Looker: got acquired, stagnating

Opportunity: Build modern, collaborative, web-first BI tool.
TAM: $10B+. Recent funding: mode.com ($200M), hex.tech ($52M)

This space is heating up 🔥

ideas_found.idea: Build a modern, collaborative, web-first business intelligence (BI) and data visualization tool—akin to 'Figma for data visualization'—targeting prosumers and enterprise teams dissatisfied with existing solutions.
ideas_found.source_context:
Opportunity: Build modern, collaborative, web-first BI tool. TAM: $10B+. Recent funding: mode.com ($200M), hex.tech ($52M)

This space is heating up 🔥

validation.market_viability: Validated by rapid growth and projections for the global data visualization market, with sizes cited between $8B and $25B in 2025, and strong CAGR (over 9%). Demand is increasing for cloud-based, collaborative, and user-friendly BI tools that offer low-code/no-code experiences and seamless integration with other business tools. Gaps exist due to dissatisfaction with legacy players (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI), often termed as bloatware or locked-in ecosystems.
validation.recent_developments: Significant venture investment as noted (Mode: $200M, Hex: $52M) shows strong appetite for new entrants. Larger market activity includes M&A (e.g., Looker acquired by Google), innovation in low-code solutions (Domo launching low-code app builder in 2024), and expansion by other players like MapmyIndia into AI-driven analytics. The sector is defined by surging cloud adoption and demand for real-time, user-friendly analytics tools.[4][8]
validation.key_metrics: Market size projections for data visualization tools range from $8.2 billion in 2024 to $25.77 billion by 2034, with growth rates between 7.38% and 11.2% CAGR.[4][5][6][8] Mode.com ($200M raised) and hex.tech ($52M raised) reflect active investor support. North America and Asia Pacific are identified as high-growth regions.[3][4][6]
validation.competitors: Major incumbents include Tableau (Salesforce), PowerBI (Microsoft), Qlik, SAP, and niche or next-gen players like Mode, Hex, Domo, and MapmyIndia's ClarityX. Differentiation opportunity exists for a Figma-like, collaborative, design-centric, and web-first experience.[4][5][8]
validation.feasibility_score: 9 - The combination of clear market dissatisfaction with incumbents, robust market growth, and very recent fundraising rounds for 'next-gen' players underscores high feasibility, though the field is competitive and requires a differentiated product experience.

ideas_found.next_steps: Conduct a deep competitive analysis of Mode, Hex, Domo, and recently acquired Looker. Examine whitespace left by major players for collaborative and intuitive UX/UI in web-first BI tools. Validate user pain points via surveys/interviews. Build technical feasibility assessment for Figma-like collaborative UI. Identify potential partners for go-to-market in North America and Asia Pacific.

output.summary: There is a substantial, validated business and investment opportunity to build a modern, collaborative, web-first BI/data visualization platform inspired by Figma’s design-centric, multi-user paradigm. Multiple indicators—market size, growth rate, VC funding, and visible dissatisfaction with legacy offerings—confirm the sector is fertile for innovation, especially from a product-led, UX-driven challenger.
